company_history.founding_story: Founded by an experienced accountant with 35 years of experience who was inspired by his parents-in-law's Home Care journey. The founder's journey with the Home Care Package scheme started in 2017 when his mother-in-law Inese had her driver's license revoked and his father-in-law Peter was becoming increasingly immobile.
company_history.business_evolution: Trilogy Care has experienced remarkable growth, leaping from being the 46th largest home care provider by Government funding in FY22 to 7th in FY23, representing one of the most significant growth stories in the Australian aged care sector.

mission_vision_values.mission: To support older Australians to live independently by offering a flexible, self-managed approach to care that gives clients more choice, control and value.
mission_vision_values.vision: Using technology to give people more time to care, connect and change lives. AI doesn't replace the human touch - it enables it.
core_values: Choice and control for care recipients
mission_vision_values.cultural_assessment: AI-first culture with emphasis on human connection. Every employee from Development to front-line care has access to generative AI tools. Fosters a culture of openness, encouraging fresh and effective approaches in care delivery.

business_model.target_market: Older Australians seeking self-managed home care packages
business_model.value_proposition: Lower administration fees, allowing higher proportion of allocated funding to be spent on actual services. Self-management model provides more choice and control.
business_model.pricing_model: Administration fee structure lower than market competitors

corporate_structure.headquarters: Level 3, 2 King Street, Bowen Hills, QLD 4006
corporate_structure.organizational_hierarchy: Board of Directors with professional expertise in financial, aged care and health care management and governance

key_executives.name: Glen Kilpatrick
key_executives.background: Expertise in aged care industry with focus on technology integration

leadership_team.board_composition: Carefully selected board with visionary leadership focused on shaping the future of aged care
leadership_team.management_background: Leadership team possesses extensive experience spanning diverse industries

product_service_portfolio.service_differentiation: Self-management model allowing direct engagement with chosen care workers, lower administration fees, flexible approach
product_service_portfolio.market_positioning: One of Australia's fastest-growing home care providers focusing on self-managed care

primary_segments: Older Australians with Home Care Packages
Families looking for flexible care options
target_customers.customer_demographics: Home Care Package recipients across Australia, particularly those seeking greater control over their care

technology_infrastructure.ai_integration: AI-first approach with generative AI tools accessible to all employees. AI integrated into workflows for service utilization tracking, provider compliance, budget performance, and client feedback monitoring.
technology_infrastructure.development_approach: AI-first architecture where AI orchestration is fundamental to solutions

office_locations.address: Level 3, 2 King Street, Bowen Hills, QLD 4006
office_locations.description: Expansive new King Street office with excellent facilities, close to public transport, cafes, restaurants and supermarkets

geographic_presence.market_coverage: National Australian market with Queensland headquarters

strategic_partnerships: CareVicinity (trusted online marketplace for support workers)
Various organizations across Australia for collaborative HCP services
partnership_ecosystem.distribution_channels: Direct to consumer, online platform, referral networks

competitive_landscape.market_position: 7th largest home care provider by Government funding in Australia (FY23)
competitive_landscape.market_differentiation: Focus on self-managed care with technology enablement and lower fees

market_share_analysis.market_size: Australian aged care market: $32.2 billion (2024), projected $61.0 billion by 2033
market_share_analysis.growth_trajectory: Leaped from 46th to 7th largest provider in one year (FY22 to FY23)
market_trends: Regulatory reform with Support at Home program (Nov 2025)

brand_reputation.public_perception: Mixed - recognized for rapid growth and innovation but faces consumer complaints
brand_reputation.media_coverage: Positive coverage for growth story and technology focus
brand_reputation.customer_satisfaction: Consumer reviews indicate significant issues with service delivery and regulatory compliance
brand_reputation.industry_recognition: Recognized as one of the most significant growth stories in Australian aged care

innovation_initiatives.research_development: Focus on AI integration and care technology innovation
innovation_initiatives.innovation_culture: AI isn't a side project, it's how we build - company philosophy

Launch of Trilogy Care Portal online service platform
Expansion of King Street office facilities
recent_news_developments.media_coverage: Featured in KPMG Aged Care Market Analysis for remarkable growth

strategic_initiatives.market_expansion: National coverage focus with Queensland base

regulatory_compliance.aged_care_quality_standards: Subject to Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission oversight
regulatory_compliance.compliance_status: Operating under regulatory oversight with consumer complaints escalated to ACQSC
regulatory_challenges: Reports of non-compliance with aged care legislation

social_responsibility: Focus on enabling independent living for older Australians
Technology to enhance human care delivery

Compliance with aged care quality standards

market_vulnerabilities: Dependence on self-managed care market segment

key_findings: Trilogy Care has achieved remarkable growth, rising from 46th to 7th largest home care provider in one year
Company is positioned as an AI-first aged care provider with technology at core of operations
Self-managed care model provides competitive advantage through lower fees and increased client control
Faces significant regulatory scrutiny and consumer satisfaction challenges
Brisbane King Street office serves as technology and operations hub
strategic_implications: Strong growth trajectory indicates market opportunity and execution capability
Technology focus aligns with industry digitization trends
Regulatory challenges may impact long-term sustainability
Self-managed model positioning for upcoming Support at Home program reforms
risk_assessment: Regulatory compliance risks from consumer complaints
Reputation risks from service delivery issues
Market concentration risk in self-managed segment
Technology execution risks for AI-first strategy
